data.title: 15 Langchain Projects to Enhance Your Portfolio in 2025 - ProjectPro
data.snippet:
GitHub Repository: 

## LangChain Projects in Python

In this section, you will find LangChain projects that can be easily implemented in Python.

### 11) HRGPT

The HR GPT project is a transformative leap in the realm of Human Resources, offering an AI-powered assistant within Slack, designed to streamline employee support, onboarding processes, and myriad HR functions. This groundbreaking initiative stands on the shoulders of LangChain, integrating LLMChain and RetrievalQA to ensure comprehensive and accurate responses to an array of inquiries, from introductory questions to complex calculations like stock vesting schedules. [...] LangChain Projects on GitHub

6) A Search Query App

7) CSV-AI (CSV Files Analyzer)

8) Twitter Agent

9) Instrukt

10) SolidGPT

LangChain Projects in Python

12) Math Problems Solver

13) Food Recipe Guide

14) Resume Analyzer

15) Code Review Assistant

## LangChain Project Ideas for Beginners

We will start this blog with beginner-friendly LangChain project ideas tailored to ignite your journey into leveraging LangChain for building exciting AI projects.

### 1) ChatBot [...] GitHub Repository: 

### 9) Instrukt

Instrukt, a robust terminal-based AI environment driven by LangChain, revolutionizes user interaction by facilitating the creation and management of modular AI agents. These agents, designed as simple Python libraries, offer remarkable versatility, allowing users to create, share, and augment them with tools and document indexes. Through an intuitive interface powered by the Textual TUI library, users efficiently interact with AI agents via keyboard and mouse, delivering a streamlined experience within the terminal.

data.title: LangChain raises $1.25B, launches new features and products
data.snippet:
Lauren H., graphic

So excited to be a part of this team and to get our users on v1.0!!

Jason Tozzi, graphic

Humbled to be part of this amazing team at LangChain. Here's to the journey ahead and to empowering our customers to build the agents of the future! ðŸš€
#LangChain #AI #AgentEngineering

Woot woot!!!!

## More Relevant Posts

View profile for Christian Bromann [...] AI is changing engineering. Developers are no longer trying to figure out if their apps are up or down. Theyâ€™re trying to see if their agents are wrong or right. Then find out why.
This new technology requires a new way of building: agent engineering - the iterative process of refining unpredictable LLM systems into something that works. And thatâ€™s what weâ€™re focused on.
Today, LangChain announced weâ€™ve raised a $125M Series B at a $1.25B valuation from IVP, Sequoia, Benchmark, Capital G, Sapphire Ventures and more, to build the platform for agent engineering. Awesome companies - from AI startups like Replit, Clay and Harvey, to enterprises like Cisco and Workday - use our stuff. [...] LangChain is and has always been the real deal. Before there were reasoning models, RL environments, and computer use agents; there was a framework that enabled AI engineers and other developers to quickly prototype, build, and iterate on AI apps by connecting disparate models and model APIs and integrating other services. But as model capabilities have evolved, the company and it's set of tools have too. LangChain is now a robust toolkit for building agentic apps; for creating agents that not only generate outputs but also take action autonomously. They not only help AI engineers build quickly and efficiently but also build apps that are reliable, observable, and secure. Undoubtedly, this company will continue to define what AI infrastructure \is\ and what it means to be an AI engineer.

# Recap of Interrupt 2025: The AI Agent Conference by LangChain

Hear more about the product launches, keynote themes, and exciting news from our first-ever conference.

That's a wrap on Interrupt 2025! This year, 800 folks from across the globe gathered in San Francisco for LangChain's first industry conference to hear stories of teams building agents â€“ and weâ€™re still riding the high! Cisco, Uber, Replit, LinkedIn, Blackrock, JPMorgan, Harvey, and more shared lessons on architectures, evals, observability, and prompting strategies â€“ both their challenges and their wins.
